<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[735, 214, 905, 256]]<|/det|>  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 276, 324, 292]]<|/det|>
## FURTHER MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[832, 277, 904, 292]]<|/det|>
9231/21  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 300, 368, 316]]<|/det|>
Paper 2 Further Pure Mathematics 2  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[707, 301, 905, 316]]<|/det|>
October/November 2022  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[841, 325, 905, 340]]<|/det|>
2 hours  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 355, 393, 370]]<|/det|>
You must answer on the question paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 384, 393, 400]]<|/det|>
You will need: List of formulae (MF19)  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 418, 230, 433]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 435, 280, 450]]<|/det|>
Answer all questions.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 450, 760, 466]]<|/det|>
Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 466, 808, 482]]<|/det|>
Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 482, 562, 497]]<|/det|>
Write your answer to each question in the space provided.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 498, 485, 512]]<|/det|>
Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 513, 361, 527]]<|/det|>
Do not write on any bar codes.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 528, 866, 559]]<|/det|>
If additional space is needed, you should use the lined page at the end of this booklet; the question number or numbers must be clearly shown.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 560, 480, 575]]<|/det|>
You should use a calculator where appropriate.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 575, 880, 606]]<|/det|>
You must show all necessary working clearly; no marks will be given for unsupported answers from a calculator.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 606, 860, 637]]<|/det|>
Give non- exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 666, 220, 680]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 682, 384, 697]]<|/det|>
The total mark for this paper is 75.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 698, 728, 713]]<|/det|>
The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 75, 96, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 715, 94]]<|/det|>
Find the Maclaurin's series for \(\ln (1 + \mathrm{e}^{x})\) up to and including the term in \(x^{2}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 75, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 72, 99, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 146, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 72, 426, 89]]<|/det|>
Show that the system of equations

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[453, 98, 571, 116]]<|/det|>
\[x - y + 2z = 4,\]

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[453, 119, 571, 137]]<|/det|>
\[x - y - 3z = a,\]

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[453, 139, 581, 158]]<|/det|>
\[x - y + 7z = 13,\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 164, 581, 183]]<|/det|>
where \(a\) is a constant, does not have a unique solution.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 164, 920, 183]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 350, 144, 368]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 350, 920, 384]]<|/det|>
Given that \(a = - 5\), show that the system of equations in part **(a)** is consistent. Interpret this situation geometrically.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 365, 920, 384]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 644, 139, 663]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 644, 920, 679]]<|/det|>
Given instead that \(a \neq - 5\), show that the system of equations in part **(a)** is inconsistent. Interpret this situation geometrically.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 660, 920, 679]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 97, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 72, 416, 89]]<|/det|>
The curve \(C\) has parametric equations

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[314, 100, 724, 121]]<|/det|>
\[x = \mathrm{e}^{t} - \frac{1}{3} t^{3},\quad y = 4\mathrm{e}^{\frac{1}{2} (t - 2)},\qquad \mathrm{for} 0\leqslant t\leqslant 2.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 133, 395, 152]]<|/det|>
Find, in terms of e, the length of \(C\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 133, 920, 152]]<|/det|>
<mark>[6]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 97, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 73, 146, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 72, 798, 92]]<|/det|>
Starting from the definitions of cosh and sinh in terms of exponentials, prove that

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[435, 101, 599, 122]]<|/det|>
\[\cosh^{2}x - \sinh^{2}x = 1.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 102, 920, 121]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 490, 186, 508]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[186, 489, 452, 510]]<|/det|>
Show that \(\frac{\mathrm{d}}{\mathrm{dx}} (\tan^{-1}(\sinh x)) = \mathrm{sech}x.\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 490, 920, 509]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 73, 144, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 72, 698, 92]]<|/det|>
Sketch the graph of \(y = \text{sech} x\), stating the equation of the asymptote.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 72, 920, 91]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 381, 146, 400]]<|/det|>
<label>(d)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 381, 838, 402]]<|/det|>
By considering a suitable set of \(n\) rectangles of unit width, use your sketch to show that

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[406, 402, 625, 444]]<|/det|>
\[\sum_{r = 1}^{n}\mathrm{sech}\,r< \tan^{-1}(\sinh n).\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 413, 920, 432]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 460, 917, 479]]<|/det|>
<form>......

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 500, 917, 518]]<|/det|>
<form>......

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 540, 917, 558]]<|/det|>
<form>......

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 580, 917, 598]]<|/det|>
<form>......

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 620, 917, 638]]<|/det|>
<form>......

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 660, 917, 678]]<|/det|>
<form>......

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 700, 917, 718]]<|/det|>
<form>......

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 740, 917, 758]]<|/det|>
<form>......

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 845, 143, 864]]<|/det|>
<label>(e)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 841, 608, 866]]<|/det|>
Hence state an upper bound, in terms of \(\pi\), for \(\sum_{r = 1}^{\infty} \mathrm{sech} r\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 846, 920, 865]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 885, 917, 904]]<|/det|>
<form>......

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 923, 917, 940]]<|/det|>
<form>......

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 945, 175, 962]]<|/det|>
© UCLES 2022

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 96, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>5</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 71, 544, 91]]<|/det|>
Find the particular solution of the differential equation

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[393, 92, 641, 126]]<|/det|>
\[2\frac{\mathrm{d}^{2}y}{\mathrm{dx}^{2}} + 2\frac{\mathrm{dy}}{\mathrm{dx}} + y = 4x^{2} + 3x + 3,\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 141, 405, 170]]<|/det|>
given that, when \(x = 0\), \(y = \frac{\mathrm{dy}}{\mathrm{dx}} = 0\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[880, 147, 920, 165]]<|/det|>
<mark>[10]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 72, 96, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>6</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 316, 89]]<|/det|>
The matrix \(\mathbf{A}\) is given by

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[445, 97, 593, 153]]<|/det|>
\[\mathbf{A} = \begin{pmatrix} 2 & -3 & -7 \\ 0 & 5 & 7 \\ 0 & 0 & -2 \end{pmatrix}.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 163, 146, 182]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 163, 662, 182]]<|/det|>
Find a matrix \(\mathbf{P}\) and a diagonal matrix \(\mathbf{D}\) such that \(\mathbf{A}^5 = \mathbf{P}\mathbf{D}\mathbf{P}^{-1}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 163, 920, 182]]<|/det|>
<mark>[7]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 146, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 71, 539, 88]]<|/det|>
Use the characteristic equation of \(\mathbf{A}\) to show that

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[455, 100, 583, 120]]<|/det|>
\[\mathbf{A}^{4} = a\mathbf{A}^{2} + b\mathbf{I},\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 133, 504, 151]]<|/det|>
where \(a\) and \(b\) are integers to be determined.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 133, 920, 151]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 75, 99, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>7</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 75, 143, 94]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 75, 675, 95]]<|/det|>
State the sum of the series \(1 + w + w^{2} + w^{3} + \ldots +w^{n - 1}\), for \(w \neq 1\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 75, 918, 94]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 168, 144, 187]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 168, 918, 191]]<|/det|>
Show that \((1 + \mathrm{i}\tan \theta)^{k} = \sec^{k}\theta (\cos k\theta +\mathrm{i}\sin k\theta)\), where \(\theta\) is not an integer multiple of \(\frac{1}{2}\pi\). [2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 322, 144, 341]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 312, 500, 356]]<|/det|>
By considering \(\sum_{k = 0}^{n - 1}(1 + \mathrm{i}\tan \theta)^{k}\), show that

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[351, 357, 685, 401]]<|/det|>
\[\sum_{k = 0}^{n - 1}\sec^{k}\theta \sin k\theta = \cot \theta (1 - \sec^{n}\theta \cos n\theta),\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 413, 504, 435]]<|/det|>
provided \(\theta\) is not an integer multiple of \(\frac{1}{2}\pi\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 415, 920, 434]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[432, 73, 567, 90]]<|/det|>
# Additional page  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 102, 910, 136]]<|/det|>
If you use the following page to complete the answer to any question, the question number must be clearly shown.
